listitem.para: Create a user named "globus". This non-privileged user will be used to perform administrative tasks. Pick an installation directory, and make sure this account has read and write permissions in the installation directory.

important.para: If for some reason you do not create a user named "globus", be sure to run the installation as a non-root user. In that case, make sure to pick an install directory that your user account has write access to.

listitem.para: Download the required software noted in .
In this guide we will assume that you are installing to /usr/local/globus-&shortversion;, but you may replace /usr/local/globus-&shortversion; with whatever directory you wish to install to.
You can use command line arguments to ./configure for a more custom install. Here are the lines to enable features which are disabled by default:
listitem.programlisting: Optional Features: --enable-udt Enable udt --enable-gram5-server Enable gram5-server --enable-gram5-lsf Enable gram5-lsf --enable-gram5-sge Enable gram5-sge --enable-gram5-slurm Enable gram5-slurm --enable-gram5-condor Enable gram5-condor --enable-gram5-pbs Enable gram5-pbs
